reviews.review: This is bullshit! I have no fucking idea what's happening half way through the fucking movie. I rather watch the motherfucking emoji movie. I watched un boxing videos better than this shit. What the fuck even happens at the end! FUUUUUUUUCK THIS DAMN MOVIE. What I rate it?  Not MARVELous and utter DC bullshit!
Legendary doesn't even begin to do this film justice. I'm still blown away a few weeks after seeing it.
The best installment to the MCU yet !
Awesome action!  Every character's personality is well represented, and they all get their chance to shine.  Can't wait until the next one comes out.  Much better than Disney's Star [Justice] Wars.
This was like seeing a triple-feature. Surprising amount of screen time for all.

I was disappointed with the movie.  The Hulk was only in it for a moment and the Bruce Banner was in a big Ironman suit the rest of the movie.  Captain American was dressed all in black with 2 small black shields.  Didn't even look like Capt. America ought to look.  He needs to be in red/white and blue AKA America!!!   Fight scenes are to long and I fell asleep once.  Then the ending sucked, I know it is just for a sequel, but a movie this long needed a ending, it is already obvious there will be more.  I will watch the next one on DVD.

A great addition to the MCU and this shows just how great the MCU is. This movies major criticism of being an unfinished story is not exactly true as it is only the first part of the story as we need to wait till next year to really see if the story is unfinished.

A cavalcade of faces, effects, and personalities, Infinity War asks novel questions like â??Should one be sacrificed to save the many?â??, â??Who wrote this?â??, and â??Should one be sacrificed to save the many?â??.  The movie starts out with decent enough character and pacing, and continues to build until the plot and character decisions spiral wildly out of control. I would describe it as â??ultimately tiresomeâ??.  The key to success, in my opinion, is for the film to not take itself too seriously, which with so many character identities to protect, can be quite the task, but a task which I believe Infinity War succeeds in through small interactions, but fails at in grand arc.
